name: market for wood preservation, dipping/immersion method, water-based, indoor use, dry | wood preservation, dipping/immersion method, water-based, indoor use, dry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/10923/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'wood preservation, dipping/immersion method, water-based, indoor use, dry', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This is delivering the service of wood preservation with the water-based dipping/immersion method. The service represents the surface treatment of 1kg dried wood with a diluted water-based wood preservative for use class 1 (for indoor, dry use,) in the dipping/immersion process. The treatment takes place in open tank impregnation with the wood preservatives to penetrate the wood no more than three milimeters wood. The process includes  inputs of the wood preservative, electricity consumption,  infrastructure, emissions and end-of-life. The input of wood is excluded and should be added manually.         

This activity starts with the service generation.


This activity ends with the service supplied to its consumers. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/161:Sawmilling and planing of wood/1610:Sawmilling and planing of wood
